company: Fraunhofer Institute for Integrated Circuits IIS

details.title: Smart Sensing and Analytics
details.description: MSc. Internship, built a Scikit-Learn \& TensorFlow based Machine-Learning pipeline for classification of LOS/NLOS 5G \& GNSS signal to further enhance positioning algorithm accuracy. Created Jupyter notebooks for ML-pipeline and documented data preprocessing. Performed ANOVA testing and PCA for feature selection. Migrated code for Kalman filter from MATLAB into python and ran unit-tests to verify and debug code execution.
details.languages: MATLAB SketchUp Blender Spirent SimGEN Oktal-SE SE-NAV

details.title: Sensor Fusion and Localization
details.description: Designed a new Positioning Referece Signal for 5G (3GPP Release 16) and compared the positioning accuracy of state of the art with LTE-based Observed Time Difference Of Arrival multilateration . Implemented a MATLAB based simulation using a statistical Quadriga Channel model and Ray-tracing model of Indoor Office environment. Added Object-oriented PRS module to the codebase using CI/CD pipeline of the team. Built a GUI to visualize real-time TDOA simulation with mobile base stations.

details.title: Smart Sensing and Analytics
details.description: Assisted a team in developing a testbed for 5G - New Radio signalling. Pre-processed survey data from Bayerisches Landesvermessungsamt to generate a 3D model of the Nürnberg for later use in SE-NAV ray-tracing software. Executed moving and coverage simulations to map the positioning accuracy using 5G base station. Performed remote-controlled tests using Sim-Gen via python scripts over TCP/IP for combined Satellite and 5G hybrid positioning to further improve localization accuracy.
details.languages: Python MATLAB SketchUp Blender Spirent SimGEN Oktal-SE SE-NAV

team: Cognitive Science Lab - Prof. Dr. Adele Diedrich

details.title: Monte-Carlo Simulations
details.description: Developed and debugged a series of Monte-Carlo simulations in MATLAB for psychology experiments: Multiattribute attention switching (MAAS) model and Multi-stage sequential sampling models with finite or infinite horizon and variable boundaries. Implemented tests to verify the correct logic of developed simulations.
